content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is how you can define this function in Julia:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    filter!(x -> x[1] == uppercase(x[1]), words)
end
```
This function uses the `filter!` function to remove all elements from the input list that do not start with an uppercase letter. The anonymous function `x -> x[1] == uppercase(x[1])` checks if the first character of each word is an uppercase letter, and `filter!` applies this to all words in the input list.

You can call it like this:

```julia
words = ["Dog", "cat", "Cat", "Elephant", "dog"]
keep_only_names(words)
```
The output will be `["Dog", "Cat", "Elephant"]`.
